about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: A flashing red traffic light at an intersection means:

about.name: A flashing red traffic light at an intersection means:

hasPart.assesses: A flashing red traffic light at an intersection means: | A flashing red traffic light at an intersection means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A flashing red light at an intersection means drivers are required to come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians, and proceed when the way is clear. The same is true at a stop sign.

suggestedAnswer.text: The same thing as a yield sign.

comment.text: The same thing as a yield sign.

suggestedAnswer.text: The light is about to turn green.

comment.text: The light is about to turn green.

suggestedAnswer.text: The same thing as a stop sign.

comment.text: The same thing as a stop sign.

acceptedAnswer.text: The same thing as a stop sign.

comment.text: The same thing as a stop sign.

answerExplanation.text: A flashing red light at an intersection means drivers are required to come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians, and proceed when the way is clear. The same is true at a stop sign.

comment.text: A flashing red traffic light at an intersection means: | A flashing red light at an intersection means drivers are required to come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians, and proceed when the way is clear. The same is true at a stop sign.

hasPart.name: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?

about.name: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?

hasPart.assesses: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks? | Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A diamond-shaped sign on a truck means that the load on the truck is potentially dangerous (containing gas, explosives, etc.). Vehicles displaying these signs are required to stop before crossing railroad tracks.

suggestedAnswer.text: Tank trucks with hazardous materials placards.

comment.text: Tank trucks with hazardous materials placards.

suggestedAnswer.text: Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer.

comment.text: Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer.

suggestedAnswer.text: Sport utility vehicles carrying four or more persons.

comment.text: Sport utility vehicles carrying four or more persons.

acceptedAnswer.text: Tank trucks with hazardous materials placards.

comment.text: Tank trucks with hazardous materials placards.

answerExplanation.text: A diamond-shaped sign on a truck means that the load on the truck is potentially dangerous (containing gas, explosives, etc.). Vehicles displaying these signs are required to stop before crossing railroad tracks.

comment.text: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks? | A diamond-shaped sign on a truck means that the load on the truck is potentially dangerous (containing gas, explosives, etc.). Vehicles displaying these signs are required to stop before crossing railroad tracks.

hasPart.name: When a bicyclist is making a left turn:

about.name: When a bicyclist is making a left turn:

hasPart.assesses: When a bicyclist is making a left turn: | When a bicyclist is making a left turn: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You should expect to see bicyclists driving with traffic on the road. You should not be surprised to see a bicyclist using the left lane when turning.

suggestedAnswer.text: They may use the left lane.

comment.text: They may use the left lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: They may cut through all lanes.

comment.text: They may cut through all lanes.

suggestedAnswer.text: They may wait on the side of the road.

comment.text: They may wait on the side of the road.

acceptedAnswer.text: They may use the left lane.

comment.text: They may use the left lane.

answerExplanation.text: You should expect to see bicyclists driving with traffic on the road. You should not be surprised to see a bicyclist using the left lane when turning.

comment.text: When a bicyclist is making a left turn: | You should expect to see bicyclists driving with traffic on the road. You should not be surprised to see a bicyclist using the left lane when turning.

hasPart.name: You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the:

about.name: You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the:

hasPart.assesses: You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the: | You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A broken yellow line in the center of the road indicates that traffic next to the broken yellow line may pass, if it is safe to do so.

suggestedAnswer.text: Vehicle in front of you moves to the right to let you pass.

comment.text: Vehicle in front of you moves to the right to let you pass.

suggestedAnswer.text: Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.

comment.text: Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.

suggestedAnswer.text: Yellow line next to the opposite side of the road is broken.

comment.text: Yellow line next to the opposite side of the road is broken.

acceptedAnswer.text: Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.

comment.text: Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.

answerExplanation.text: A broken yellow line in the center of the road indicates that traffic next to the broken yellow line may pass, if it is safe to do so.

comment.text: You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the: | A broken yellow line in the center of the road indicates that traffic next to the broken yellow line may pass, if it is safe to do so.

hasPart.name: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:

about.name: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:

hasPart.assesses: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving: | When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When merging onto a freeway, you should enter at or near the speed of traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: At or near the speed of traffic on the freeway.

comment.text: At or near the speed of traffic on the freeway.

suggestedAnswer.text: Five to 10 mph slower than the speed of traffic on the freeway.

comment.text: Five to 10 mph slower than the speed of traffic on the freeway.

suggestedAnswer.text: The posted speed limit for freeway traffic.

comment.text: The posted speed limit for freeway traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: At or near the speed of traffic on the freeway.

comment.text: At or near the speed of traffic on the freeway.

answerExplanation.text: When merging onto a freeway, you should enter at or near the speed of traffic.

comment.text: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving: | When merging onto a freeway, you should enter at or near the speed of traffic.

hasPart.name: If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:

about.name: If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should: | If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers must always yield the right-of-way to pedestrians in the roadway, even if there is not a marked crosswalk.

suggestedAnswer.text: Make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.

comment.text: Make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
Cautiously drive around the pedestrian.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.

comment.text: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.

acceptedAnswer.text: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.

comment.text: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers must always yield the right-of-way to pedestrians in the roadway, even if there is not a marked crosswalk.

comment.text: If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should: | Drivers must always yield the right-of-way to pedestrians in the roadway, even if there is not a marked crosswalk.
